intro: Gardenia benthamiana, commonly known as the Chinese gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white to yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is prized for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. The fruit it produces is a capsule that contains seeds, which can be used for propagation.
